subject: Darts (Game)
lead_paragraph: John Part, a Canadian, won the Professional Darts Corporation World Championship with a 7-2 victory over the English qualifier Kirk Shepherd at Alexandra Palace in London. Part, 41, who won the British Darts Organization title in 1994 and the P.D.C. crown in 2003, became the fourth person to win the world championship more than twice. He joined the 13-time champion Phil Taylor, Eric Bristow (five titles) and John Lowe (three).
